parameters.name: DateOfConfiguration
parameters.label: Collection time
parameters.query:
let _configurationEnv = split(iff(isnull({EnvironmentList}) or isempty({EnvironmentList}) or tolower({EnvironmentList}) == "all","All",tostring({EnvironmentList})),',');
ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
| extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
| where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
| extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
| summarize Collection = max(Collection)
| project Collection = "lastdate", Selected = true
| join kind= fullouter  ( ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
    | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
    | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
    | summarize by Collection 
    | join kind= fullouter ( ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
        | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
        | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
        | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
        | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm ')
        | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
        | join kind=leftouter (
            ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
            | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
            | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
            | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm')
            | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
            | summarize count() by Collection
        ) on Collection
    ) on Collection
) on Collection
| project Value = iif(Selected,Collection,iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Label = iif(Selected,"Last Known date",iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Selected
| sort by Selected, Value desc

content.json:
This workbook helps review your Exchange Security configuration.
Adjust the time range, and when needed select an item in the dropdownlist

To compare collects, select **Yes** and choose the initial date.
For each role, a new table will be displayed with **all** the modifications (Add, Remove, Modifications) beetween the two dates.

**Important notes** : Some information are limited are may be not 100% accurate :
  - Date
  - GUID of user instead of the name
  - Fusion of modifications when a role assisgnment is changed within the same collect 
  - ... 

This is due to some restrictions in the collect. For more details information, please check the workbook **"Microsoft Exchange Search AdminAuditLog - Online"**
.

The compare functionnality is not available for all sections in this workbook.

# Workbook goals

The goal of this workbook is to outline key security configurations of your Exchange on-premises environment.

Most of Exchange organizations have were installed years ago (sometimes more than 10 years). Many configurations have been done and might not have been documented. For most environments, the core commitment was maintaining a high availability of the users‚Äô mailboxes putting aside other consideration (even security considerations). Recommended security practices have also evolved since the first released and a regular review is necessary.

This workbook is designed to show your Exchange organization is configured with a security point of view. Indeed, some configurations easy to display as there are no UI available.

For each configuration, you will find explanations and recommendations when applicable.

- This workbook does not pretend to show you every weak Security configurations, but the most common issues and known to be used by attackers. 
- It will not show you if you have been comprised, but will help you identify unexpected configuration.

----

## Quick reminder of how Exchange works

During Exchange installation two very important groups are created :
- Exchange Trusted Subsystem : Contain all the computer accounts for Exchange Server
- Exchange Windows Permissions : Contain the group Exchange trusted Subsystem

These groups have :
- Very high privileges in ALL AD domains including the root domain
- Right on any Exchange including mailboxes

As each Exchange server computer account is member of Exchange Trusted Subsystem, it means by taking control of the computer account or being System on an Exchange server you will gain access to all the permissions granted to Exchange Trusted Subsystem and Exchange Windows Permissions.

To protect AD and Exchange, it is very important to ensure the following:
- There is a very limited number of persons that are local Administrator on Exchange server
- To protect user right like : Act part of the operating System, Debug

Every service account or application that have high privileges on Exchange need to be considered as sensitive

** üí° Exchange servers need to be considered as very sensitive servers**

-----


## Tabs

### Mailbox Access

This tab will show you several top sensitive delegations that allow an account to access, modify, act as another user, search, export the content of a mailbox.

### Exchange & AD Groups

This tab will show you the members of Exchange groups and Sensitive AD groups.

### Local Administrators

This tab will show you the non standard content of the local Administrators group. Remember that a member of the local Administrators group can take control of the computer account of the server and then it will have all the permissions associated with Exchange Trusted Subsytem and Exchange Windows Permissions

The information is displayed with different views : 
- List of nonstandard users
- Number of servers with a nonstandard a user
- Nonstandard groups content
- For each user important information are displayed like last logon, last password set, enabled

### Exchange Security configuration

This tab will show you some important configuration for your Exchange Organization
- Status of Admin Audit Log configuration
- Status of POP and IMAP configuration : especially, is Plaintext Authentication configured ?
- Nonstandard permissions on the Exchange container in the Configuration Partition

### Transport Configuration

This tab will show you the configuration of the main Transport components
- Receive Connectors configured with Anonymous and/or Open Relay
- Remote Domain Autoforward configuration
- Transport Rules configured with BlindCopyTo, SendTo, RedirectTo
- Journal Rule and Journal Recipient configurations
- Accepted Domains with *

content.title: Display important security configurations that allow to access mailboxes' content. Direct delegations on mailboxes are not listed (Full Access permission mailboxes or direct delegations on mailboxes  folders)

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Hygiene Management" and  CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Exchange Online-ApplicationAccount" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Discovery Management" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName !contains "RIM-MailboxAdmins"
| where CmdletResultValue.Role contains "Export" or CmdletResultValue.Role contains "Impersonation" or CmdletResultValue.Role contains "Search"
| summarize dcount(tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)) by role=tostring(CmdletResultValue.Role)
content.title: Number of accounts with sensitive RBAC roles

content.json:
**ApplicationImpersonation** is a RBAC role that allows access (read and modify) to the content of all mailboxes. This role is very powerfull and should be carefully delegated. When a delegation is necessary, RBAC scopes should be configured to limit the list of impacted mailboxes.

It is common to see service accounts for backup solution, antivirus software, MDM...

content.title: Application Impersonation Role

content.json:
This delegation allows the delegated account to access and modify the content of every mailboxes using EWS.
Excluded from the result as it is a default configuration :
Delegating delegation to Organization Management

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Role contains "Impersonation" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Hygiene Management" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName !contains "RIM-MailboxAdmins" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| extend RoleAssigneeType = iff(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "User" , "User", "RoleGroup")
| extend CustomRecipientWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomRecipientWriteScope)
| extend CustomConfigWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomConfigWriteScope)
| extend CustomResourceScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomResourceScope)
| extend RecipientWriteScope = CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope
| extend ConfigWriteScope = CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope
| extend ManagementRoleAssignement = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Status= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend RoleAssigneeName = iff( RoleAssigneeType == "User", strcat("üßë‚Äçü¶∞ ",RoleAssigneeName), strcat("üë™ ", RoleAssigneeName) )
| project RoleAssigneeName, RoleAssigneeType, Status,CustomRecipientWriteScope,CustomConfigWriteScope,CustomResourceScope,RecipientWriteScope,ConfigWriteScope,ManagementRoleAssignement,WhenChanged,WhenCreated

let ExclusionsAcctValue = dynamic(["Hygiene Management", "RIM-MailboxAdmins"]);
MESCompareDataMRA(SectionCompare="MRA",DateCompare="{DateCompare:value}",CurrentDate = "{DateOfConfiguration:value}",EnvList ={EnvironmentList},TypeEnv = "Online",ExclusionsAcct = ExclusionsAcctValue ,CurrentRole="Impersonation")

Mailbox Import Export Role

content.json:
This delegation allows to import contents in all  mailboxes.
Excluded from the result as it is a default configuration :
Delegating delegation to Organization Management

**Mailbox Import Export**  is an RBAC role that allows an account to import (export is not available online) contant in a user mailbox. It also allows searches in all mailboxes.

‚ö° This role is very powerfull.

By default, this role is not delegated to any user or group. The members of the group Organization Management by default do not have this role but are able to delegate it.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations

If you temporarily need this delegation, consider the following:
- create an empty group with this delegation
- monitor the group content and  alert when the group modified
- add administrators in this group only for a short period of time

content.json:
This delegation allows to search inside all or in a scope of mailboxes.
Excluded from the result as it is a default configuration :
Delegating delegation to Organization Management
Discovery Management has been excluded

**Mailbox Search** is an RBAC role that allows an account to search in any mailbox.

‚ö° This role is very powerfull.

By default, this role is only delegated to the group Discovery Management. The members of the group Organization Management do not have this role but are able to delegate it.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations

If you temporarily need this delegation, consider the following:

- add the administrators in the Discovery Management group
- monitor the group content and alert when the group modified
- add administrators in this group only for a short period of time

content.title: Display changes ( Add, Remove, modifications of parameters )
Exchange Group

content.json:
‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations

- Ensure that no service account are a member of the high privilege groups. Use RBAC to delegate the exact required permissions.
- Limit the usage of nested group for administration.
- Ensure that accounts are given only the required pernissions to execute their tasks.
- Use just in time administration principle by adding users in a group only when they need the permissions, then remove them when their operation is over.
- Limit the number of Organization management members. When you review the Admin Audit logs you might see that the administrators rarely needed Organization Management privileges.
- Monitor the content of the following groups:
  - TenantAdmins_-xxx (Membership in this role group is synchronized across services and managed centrally)
  - Organization Management
  - ExchangeServiceAdmins_-xxx (Membership in this role group is synchronized across services and managed centrally)
  - Recipient Management (Member of this group have at least the following rights : set-mailbox, Add-MailboxPermission)
  - Discovery Management
  - Hygiene Management
  - Security Administrator (Membership in this role group is synchronized across services and managed centrally)
  - xxx High privilege group (not an exhaustive list)
  - Compliance Management
  - All RBAC groups that have high roles delegation
  - All nested groups in high privileges groups
  - Note that this is not a complete list. The content of all the groups that have high privileges should be monitored.
- Each time a new RBAC group is created, decide if the content of this groups should be monitored
- Periodically review the members of the groups

content.title: Number of  direct members per group with RecipientType User

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RoleGroupMember",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| project CmdletResultValue
//| where CmdletResultValue.RecipientType !contains "group"
| extend Members= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
| summarize dcount(tostring(Members)) by RoleGroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleGroup)
| where RoleGroup has_any ("TenantAdmins","Organization Management", "Discovery Management", "Compliance  Management", "Server Management", "ExchangeServiceAdmins","Security Administrator", "SecurityAdmins", "Recipient Manangement", "Records Manangement","Impersonation","Export")
| sort by dcount_Members

content.title: Number of  direct members per group with RecipientType User

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RoleGroupMember",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| project CmdletResultValue
| where CmdletResultValue.RecipientType !contains "group"
| extend Members= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
| summarize dcount(tostring(Members)) by RoleGroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleGroup)
| sort by dcount_Members

parameters.name: Group
parameters.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RoleGroup",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
//| where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup != "Exchange Trusted Subsystem"
//| where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup != "Exchange Windows Permissions"

content.title: Transport Security configuration
Inbound Connector configuration

content.json: This section shows the configuration of the Inbound connnectors

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="InBoundC",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Name = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend ConnectorType = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorType)
| extend ConnectorSource = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorSource)
| extend SenderIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderIPAddresses)
| extend SenderDomains = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderDomains)
| extend TrustedOrganizations = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TrustedOrganizations)
| extend AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls)
| extend RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses)
| extend RestrictDomainsToCertificate = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToCertificate)
| extend CloudServicesMailEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CloudServicesMailEnabled)
| extend TreatMessagesAsInternal = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TreatMessagesAsInternal)
| extend TlsSenderCertificateName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TlsSenderCertificateName)
| extend ScanAndDropRecipients = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ScanAndDropRecipients)
| extend Comment = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Comment)
| extend WhenChanged = tostring(CmdletResultValue.WhenChanged)
| extend WhenCreated = tostring(CmdletResultValue.WhenCreated)
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Name asc

let _EnvList ={EnvironmentList};
let _TypeEnv = "Online";
let _DateCompare = "{DateCompare:value}";
let _CurrentDate = "{DateOfConfiguration:value}";
let _DateCompareB = todatetime(_DateCompare);
let _currD = (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="InBoundC",SpecificConfigurationDate=_CurrentDate,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
| summarize TimeMax = arg_max(TimeGenerated,*)
| extend TimeMax = tostring(split(TimeMax,"T")[0])
| project TimeMax);
let _CurrentDateB = todatetime(toscalar(_currD));
let BeforeData =  ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="InBoundC",SpecificConfigurationDate=_DateCompareB,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
    | extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
	| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
	| extend ConnectorType = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorType)
	| extend ConnectorSource = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorSource)
	| extend SenderIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderIPAddresses)
	| extend SenderDomains = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderDomains)
	| extend TrustedOrganizations = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TrustedOrganizations)
	| extend AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToCertificate = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToCertificate)
	| extend CloudServicesMailEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CloudServicesMailEnabled)
	| extend TreatMessagesAsInternal = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TreatMessagesAsInternal)
	| extend TlsSenderCertificateName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TlsSenderCertificateName)
	| extend ScanAndDropRecipients = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ScanAndDropRecipients)
	| extend Comment = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Comment)
    | extend WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged)
    | extend WhenCreated = todatetime(WhenCreated)
;
let AfterData = 
     ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="InBoundC",SpecificConfigurationDate=_CurrentDate,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
   	| extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
	| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
	| extend ConnectorType = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorType)
	| extend ConnectorSource = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorSource)
	| extend SenderIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderIPAddresses)
	| extend SenderDomains = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderDomains)
	| extend TrustedOrganizations = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TrustedOrganizations)
	| extend AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToCertificate = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToCertificate)
	| extend CloudServicesMailEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CloudServicesMailEnabled)
	| extend TreatMessagesAsInternal = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TreatMessagesAsInternal)
	| extend TlsSenderCertificateName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TlsSenderCertificateName)
	| extend ScanAndDropRecipients = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ScanAndDropRecipients)
	| extend Comment = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Comment)
    | extend WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged)
    | extend WhenCreated = todatetime(WhenCreated)
;
let i=0;
let allDataRange = 
    ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
    | where TimeGenerated between (_DateCompareB .. _CurrentDateB)
    | where ESIEnvironment_s == _EnvList
    | where ExecutionResult_s <> "EmptyResult"
    | where Section_s == "InBoundC"
    | extend CmdletResultValue = parse_json(rawData_s)
    | project TimeGenerated,CmdletResultValue,WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged_t), WhenCreated=todatetime(WhenCreated_t)
   	| extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
	| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
	| extend ConnectorType = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorType)
	| extend ConnectorSource = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ConnectorSource)
	| extend SenderIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderIPAddresses)
	| extend SenderDomains = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderDomains)
	| extend TrustedOrganizations = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TrustedOrganizations)
	| extend AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses)
	| extend RestrictDomainsToCertificate = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RestrictDomainsToCertificate)
	| extend CloudServicesMailEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CloudServicesMailEnabled)
	| extend TreatMessagesAsInternal = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TreatMessagesAsInternal)
	| extend TlsSenderCertificateName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.TlsSenderCertificateName)
	| extend ScanAndDropRecipients = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ScanAndDropRecipients)
	| extend Comment = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Comment)
    ;
let DiffAddDataP1 = allDataRange
  | join kind = rightanti  (AfterData | where WhenCreated >=_DateCompareB) on WhenCreated
;
let DiffAddDataP2 = allDataRange
    | join kind = innerunique   (allDataRange ) on WhenCreated
    | where WhenCreated >=_DateCompareB
    | where bin(WhenCreated,5m)==bin(WhenChanged,5m)
    | distinct  Identity,State,ConnectorType,ConnectorSource,SenderIPAddresses,SenderDomains,TrustedOrganizations,AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls,RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses,RestrictDomainsToCertificate,CloudServicesMailEnabled,TreatMessagesAsInternal,TlsSenderCertificateName,ScanAndDropRecipients,Comment,WhenChanged,WhenCreated
 ;
let DiffAddData = union DiffAddDataP1,DiffAddDataP2
| extend Actiontype ="Add";
let DiffRemoveData = allDataRange
    | join kind = leftanti AfterData on Identity
    | extend Actiontype ="Remove"
    | distinct  Actiontype ,Identity,State,ConnectorType,ConnectorSource,SenderIPAddresses,SenderDomains,TrustedOrganizations,AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls,RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses,RestrictDomainsToCertificate,CloudServicesMailEnabled,TreatMessagesAsInternal,TlsSenderCertificateName,ScanAndDropRecipients,Comment,WhenCreated
    | project  WhenChanged=_CurrentDateB,Actiontype,Identity,State,ConnectorType,ConnectorSource,SenderIPAddresses,SenderDomains,TrustedOrganizations,AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls,RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses,RestrictDomainsToCertificate,CloudServicesMailEnabled,TreatMessagesAsInternal,TlsSenderCertificateName,ScanAndDropRecipients,Comment,WhenCreated
    ;
let DiffModifData = union AfterData,allDataRange
| sort by Identity,WhenChanged asc
| project WhenChanged,Identity,State,ConnectorType,ConnectorSource,SenderIPAddresses,SenderDomains,TrustedOrganizations,AssociatedAcceptedDomainsRequireTls,RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses,RestrictDomainsToCertificate,CloudServicesMailEnabled,TreatMessagesAsInternal,TlsSenderCertificateName,ScanAndDropRecipients,Comment,WhenCreated
| extend Identity = iff( Identity == prev(Identity) and Identity != prev(Identity) and prev(Identity) !="" , strcat("üìç ", Identity, " (",prev(Identity),"->", Identity," )"),Identity)
| extend State = iff( Identity == prev(Identity) and State != prev(State) and prev(State) !="" , strcat("üìç ", State, " (",prev(State),"->", State," )"),State)

content.title: Display changes ( Add, Remove, modifications of parameters )
Transport Rules with specific actions to monitor

content.json:
A  common way used by attackers to exfiltrate data is to set Transport Rules that send all or sensitive messages outside the organization or to a mailbox where they already have full control.

This section shows your Transport rules with sentitive actions that can lead to data leaks:
- BlindCopyTo
- SentTo
- CopyTo

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="TransportRule",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Identity = iif( CmdletResultValue.Identity contains "OrgHierarchyToIgnore",tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.Name),tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity))
| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.State)
| extend SentTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SentToString)
| extend BlindCopyTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.BlindCopyToString)
| extend CopyTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CopyToString)
| extend RedirectMessageTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RedirectMessageToString)
| extend SetSCL = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SetSCL)
| extend SenderIpRangesString = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SenderIpRangesString)
| extend MessageTypeMatchesString = tostring(CmdletResultValue.MessageTypeMatchesString)
| extend Mode = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Mode)
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Identity asc

content.title: Display changes ( Add, Remove, modifications of parameters )
Outbound Policy :  Autoforward configuration

content.json:
If **AutoForwardEnabled** is enabled, then automatic transfer are allowed.
For example: users in Outlook will be able set automatic transfer of all their emails to external addresses.
There are several methods to authorized automatic forward. 
Please review this article : https://learn.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/outbound-spam-policies-external-email-forwarding?view=o365-worldwide
**In summary :**

**Scenario 1 :**

You configure remote domain settings to allow automatic forwarding.
Automatic forwarding in the outbound spam filter policy is set to Off.
*Result :* 
Automatically forwarded messages to recipients in the affected domains are blocked.

**Scenario 2 :**

You configure remote domain settings to allow automatic forwarding.
Automatic forwarding in the outbound spam filter policy is set to Automatic - System-controlled.

*Result :* 

Automatically forwarded messages to recipients in the affected domains are blocked.
As described earlier, Automatic - System-controlled used to mean On, but the setting has changed over time to mean Off in all organizations.

For absolute clarity, you should configure your outbound spam filter policy to On or Off.

**Scenario 3 :**

Automatic forwarding in the outbound spam filter policy is set to On
You use mail flow rules or remote domains to block automatically forwarded email

*Result : *

Automatically forwarded messages to affected recipients are blocked by mail flow rules or remote domains.
****
Also, when setting AutoForwardEnabled to a specific domain, it is strongly recommended enable TLS encryption.

content.title: Display changes ( Add, Remove, modifications of parameters )
Remote Domain Autofoward Configuration - * should not allow AutoForwardEnabled

content.json:
If **AutoForwardEnabled** is set to True for an SMTP domain and the Outbound Policy is set to On then users in Outlook are allowed to set automatic transfer of all their emails to addresses in this domain.

When the Default Remote domain is set to * and has the AutoForwardEnabled set True, any user can configure an Outlook rule to automatically forward all emails to any SMTP domain domains outside the organization. This is a high risk configuration as it might allow accounts to leak information. 

Also, when setting AutoForwardEnabled to a specific domain, it is strongly recommended enable TLS encryption.

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RemoteDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Name =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Address =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName)
| extend AutoForwardEnabled =  iff (CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled== "true" and CmdletResultValue.DomainName == "*", strcat ("‚ùå ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)),iff(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled== "true" and CmdletResultValue.DomainName != "*", strcat ("‚ö†Ô∏è ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)),strcat ("‚úÖ ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled))))
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Address asc

let _DateCompare = "{DateCompare:value}";
let _CurrentDate = "{DateOfConfiguration:value}";
let _DateCompareB = todatetime(_DateCompare);
let _currD = (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RemoteDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate=_CurrentDate,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
| summarize TimeMax = arg_max(TimeGenerated,*)
| extend TimeMax = tostring(split(TimeMax,"T")[0])
| project TimeMax);
let _CurrentDateB = todatetime(toscalar(_currD));
let BeforeData =  ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RemoteDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate=_DateCompareB,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
    | extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
	| extend DomainName  = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName)
	| extend AutoForwardEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)
	| extend WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged)
    | extend WhenCreated = todatetime(WhenCreated)
;
let AfterData = 
     ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RemoteDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate=_CurrentDate,SpecificConfigurationEnv=_EnvList,Target = _TypeEnv)
   	    | extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
	| extend DomainName  = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName)
	| extend AutoForwardEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)
    | extend WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged)
    | extend WhenCreated = todatetime(WhenCreated)
;
let i=0;
let allDataRange = 
    ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
    | where TimeGenerated between (_DateCompareB .. _CurrentDateB)
    | where ESIEnvironment_s == _EnvList
    | where ExecutionResult_s <> "EmptyResult"
    | where Section_s == "RemoteDomain"
    | extend CmdletResultValue = parse_json(rawData_s)
    | project TimeGenerated,CmdletResultValue,WhenChanged = todatetime(WhenChanged_t), WhenCreated=todatetime(WhenCreated_t)
       | extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
	| extend DomainName  = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName)
	| extend AutoForwardEnabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)
    ;
let DiffAddDataP1 = allDataRange
  | join kind = rightanti  (AfterData | where WhenCreated >=_DateCompareB) on WhenCreated
;
let DiffAddDataP2 = allDataRange
    | join kind = innerunique   (allDataRange ) on WhenCreated
    | where WhenCreated >=_DateCompareB
    | where bin(WhenCreated,5m)==bin(WhenChanged,5m)
    | distinct  Identity,DomainName,AutoForwardEnabled,WhenChanged,WhenCreated
 ;
let DiffAddData = union DiffAddDataP1,DiffAddDataP2
| extend Actiontype ="Add";
let DiffRemoveData = allDataRange
    | join kind = leftanti AfterData on Identity
    | extend Actiontype ="Remove"
    | distinct  Actiontype ,Identity,DomainName,AutoForwardEnabled,WhenCreated
    | project  WhenChanged=_CurrentDateB,Actiontype,Identity,DomainName,AutoForwardEnabled,WhenCreated
    ;
let DiffModifData = union AfterData,allDataRange
| sort by Identity,WhenChanged asc
| project WhenChanged,Identity,DomainName,AutoForwardEnabled,WhenCreated
| extend Identity = iff( Identity == prev(Identity) and Identity != prev(Identity) and prev(Identity) !="" , strcat("üìç ", Identity, " (",prev(Identity),"->", Identity," )"),Identity)
| extend DomainName = iff( Identity == prev(Identity) and DomainName != prev(DomainName) and prev(DomainName) !="" , strcat("üìç ", DomainName, " (",prev(DomainName),"->", DomainName," )"),DomainName)
| extend AutoForwardEnabled = iff( Identity == prev(Identity) and AutoForwardEnabled != prev(AutoForwardEnabled) and prev(AutoForwardEnabled) !="" , strcat("üìç ", AutoForwardEnabled, " (",prev(AutoForwardEnabled),"->", AutoForwardEnabled," )"),AutoForwardEnabled)
| extend ActiontypeR =iff((Identity contains "üìç" or DomainName contains "üìç" or AutoForwardEnabled contains "üìç" ), i=i + 1, i)
| extend Actiontype =iff(ActiontypeR > 0, "Modif", "NO")
| where ActiontypeR == 1
| project WhenChanged,Actiontype,Identity,DomainName,AutoForwardEnabled,WhenCreated
;
union DiffAddData, DiffRemoveData, DiffModifData
| extend WhenChanged = iff (Actiontype == "Modif", WhenChanged, iff(Actiontype == "Add",WhenCreated, WhenChanged))
| extend Actiontype = case(Actiontype == "Add", strcat("‚ûï ", Actiontype), Actiontype == "Remove", strcat("‚ûñ ", Actiontype), Actiontype == "Modif", strcat("üìç ", Actiontype), "N/A")
| sort by WhenChanged desc 
| project
    WhenChanged,
    Actiontype,
    Identity,
    DomainName,
    AutoForwardEnabled,
    WhenCreated
content.title: Display changes ( Add, Remove, modifications of parameters )
